title.narrative: Independent Appraisal of MTV EXIT Asia Phase IV

description.narrative: Trafficking in Persons (TIP) is a violation of human rights as it limits both freedom and dignity and undermines individual self-determination. In Asia- Pacific, the Australian Government currently funding a number of initiatives to strengthen national and regional capacity to respond and to prevent this growing transnational crime. The Australian Government complements these measures by also supporting the MTV EXIT Foundation (MTV EF), which is a prevention effort that raises awareness amongst at-risk populations about the dangers of human trafficking. Funding under this proposal will support an independent appraisal of the draft project design of the MTV EXIT Asia Program Phase IV. The total value of this initiative is $4,000 expensed in the 2012-13 financial year.
